title: (x) rounded General Electric corporate face - GE Inspira (custom) {Yves}
content:
What is the ’New Frontiers’ font from this link?:

[http://www.ge.com/en/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013084133/http:/www.ge.com/en/ "http://www.ge.com/en/")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [What's this font?.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013084133/http:/typophile.com/files/What's%20this%20font?_0.jpg) | 86.9 KB |

 [‹ (x) Widex signature typeface - Eurostile, FF Meta {Dav, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013084133/http:/typophile.com/node/14404 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Brand Watcher graphic identity - ITC Avant Garde Gothic w/ Alternates {Nicolai} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013084133/http:/typophile.com/node/14502 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Frank Nichols

comments.content: General Electric uses GE Inspira, a custom proprietary font. This has come up before, but I don’t know if I’ll be able to dig up the relevant thread in the archives.
More info on the rebranding on [Speak Up](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013084133/http:/www.underconsideration.com/speakup/archives/002021.html#002021).
